results.title: Senior Account Manager
results.description:
Senior Account Manager (Covering Welsh Region)

Who are you?

We are looking for an ambitious Account Manager to drive account growth and work closely with our client wing to deliver a best-in-class service each and every time!

Key responsibilities

  • Actively manage sales cycle for existing accounts; analyse and present data to your clients on a quarterly basis and support your clients with needs-based business cases.
  • Achieve and maintain high levels of satisfaction among senior stakeholderâ€™s client side, achieving target scores from identified stakeholders.
  • Full contract management including renewals, change notices, risk mitigation and escalation, as well as involvement within bids and tenders
  • Provide internal forecasting reports on key customer commercial metrics
  • Understand what really matters to your stakeholders and the client, present benefits and value delivered to the Trust internally at Board and review meetings and via external comms
  • Work closely with sales and marketing team to generate leads into other Trusts, ICS, STP, and align strongly with our infamous transformation team to ensure we can deliver!

Â 

OK, thatâ€™s me, but who are DrDoctor?

DrDoctor is a HealthTech company on an exciting growth trajectory. Our technology focuses on engaging patients across their healthcare journey while saving hospitals time, effort, and money.

Our Mission is that healthcare needs a reset. More people need care every day and health services struggle. Current patient engagement is a mess of disparate systems that hinder, rather than help care delivery.

Our Vision is a remote-first healthcare system, which can meet demand without sacrificing care quality. We want patients to be engaged in their care, shifting to a digital first model.

We do this at scale:

  • 17 million+ patients use DrDoctor
  • We manage over 70 million appointments
  • We work with over 44 NHS Trusts and Health Boards (and still growing!)

We :green_heart: the NHS and want to help it work better. We radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone â€“ for patients, doctors, administrative teams and taxpayers.

OK, Iâ€™m interested. What experience do I need to have?

  • Demonstrable experience working with the NHS, ideally in a digital capacity.
  • Experience working as an Account Manager/Success Manager, focusing on account optimisation and upsell, with a track record in change management, project delivery or meeting sales targets
  • You know how to adapt your style to varying levels of people within the NHS
  • Have the ability to simplify a complex set of problems and structure the right solution for our clients - this may include project planning, technical understanding, benefits analysis etc.
  • You excel in a high growth, fast-paced, agile environment, and love getting the work done right
  • You are passionate about our missionâ€¯

We know from research and experience that candidates may not apply if they donâ€™t think they meet 100% of our requirements. If you donâ€™t tick all the boxes but feel you would be a good fit, we would still love to hear from you. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture!

Just to let you know too, we will need you to have the Right To Work in the UK, and as we work closely with the NHS, if we get to the stage where we make you an offer to join us, we will also need to undertake a DBS check.

We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CVs to go through. However, we donâ€™t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CVâ€™s we are not able to send an individual reply if itâ€™s not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If itâ€™s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30 minute call. Itâ€™s just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue, then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Some our roles will also be subject to completing an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

I canâ€™t wait to get started, what are the perks?

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

  • Remote by default approach - Everyone at DrDoctor will work remotely most of the time with regular opportunities to socialise and engage at office spaces available in London and Manchester.
  • Flexible working (we understand we all have family and personal commitments; you can work where you are at your best and at times when you are most productive)
  • Part time working considered - let us know what you need and weâ€™ll do our best to find the right balance for both parties
  • 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays (with our own extra DrDoctor Bank Holidays thrown in for good measure!)
  • 4 duvet days per year for those days that you just donâ€™t fancy working
  • Personal development time every other Friday, or for a whole day per month, differing based on which team youâ€™re in
  • Mental health support through our partner OpenUp and our own in-house Mental Health First Aiders
  • Drinks/other fun things sent to you in the post
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • A new office space in Southwark including a Multipurpose quiet room which can be used for activities such as Prayer, Meditation, or caring for your baby
  • Enhanced parental leave (up to 16 weeks fully paid parental leave for anyone who brings a child into their home â€“ whether this is via birth, adoption or surrogacy)
  • Salary competitive and dependant on experience, we benchmark our salaries to accurately reflect the market at least once a year, and we benchmark all of our roles (regardless of where in the UK you live) based on London salaries.
  • A focus on your career progression based on our progression framework, regular 6 months' pay reviews and mentoring opportunities
  • EMI share options scheme!

As DrDoctor has grown, we are seeing more of our people wanting to socialise in different ways.

Whilst we know that some of us love to go to the pub, we want to make sure we are including a wide variety of activities and events for our teams to enjoy each other's company, we aim to continue creating an open space for anyone and everyone to suggest how theyâ€™d like to spend time with their teams.

We love a Summer and Christmas party and regular company/team socials and away days. So far in 2022, we have enjoyed picnics at a nearby farm, a water colouring session, board games evening and Crystal Maze! We have also held various events for celebrations such as Eid ul-Fitr, Holi Festival, International Womenâ€™s Day and our 10 year anniversary!

Salary banding for this role is: Â£55,000 - Â£70,000 + Commission

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
TuxCare is a Division of CloudLinux Inc., the maker of the #1 OS in security and stability for hosting providers. TuxCare provides a set of services to automate, simplify and enhance Linux security and operations for the Enterprise. It reduces the management tasks and patch delay risks with live patching, completely bypassing the need for complex service migration orchestration even when you have high availability in place.

The TuxCare Account Executive role is the front-line of revenue generation for the business. In this role you will be responsible for daily prospect engagement by finding leads, managing the sales cycle, negotiation, and closing deals. Supported by a team of Linux experts in presales, engineering and marketing, the Account Executive is the top driver of corporate growth.

For more details go to tuxcare.com.

As our Account Executive you will be responsible for:

  • Engage with new inbound leads daily
  • Navigate prospect organizations to present our value proposition to influencers, stakeholders, and decision-makers
  • Collaborating with key decision makers to identify opportunities and develop ideas that deliver sales results
  • Following up with prospects several times throughout the sales cycle to ensure needs are being met
  • Preparing and presenting proposals and bids
  • Negotiating terms and conditions with prospects
  • Manage a pipeline of opportunities in Hubspot and communicate regularly on progress and status
  • Identify opportunities for prospects to act as public TuxCare advocates (e.g. testimonials, case studies)
  • Collaborate closely with company leadership to identify expansion opportunities
  • Work with SEs, CSM and Account Manager to ensure successful new customer adoption and onboarding
  • Staying current on company offerings and industry trends

Requirements

To be successful in this role you should have:

  • 5+ years in Business Development or Enterprise Sales
  • A successful track record showing a high close rate and expedited sales cycles
  • Knowledge of Linux infrastructure and/or security software
  • Exceptional communication skills, highly organized, collaborative and detail-oriented
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize appropriately across multiple concurrent engagements
  • Experience building and maintaining relationships, while working to mitigate risk and drive successful deal closure
  • Experience working with Hubspot is a plus

Benefits

What's in it for you?

  • A focus on professional development;
    • Training reimbursements
    • Mentor programs
    • Knowledge-Exchange programs
    • Interesting and challenging projects
  • Flexible working hours
  • Paid 24 days of vacation per year and unlimited sick leave
  • Medical insurance reimbursement
  • Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement
  • The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent.
